intro: Amperea xiphoclada var. papillata, commonly known as the hairy Amperea, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, ascending stems and small, opposite leaves. The leaves are often covered in fine, hairy glands, giving the plant its common name. It produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers with four petals. This species is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or rocky crevices.
